org.codice.ddf.migration.util

Class MigratableUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codice.ddf.migration.util.MigratableUtil

  • public class MigratableUtil
extends Object
    Utility class for services that implement Migratable.

    This code is experimental. While this interface is functional and tested, it may change or be removed in a future version of the library.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MigratableUtil

        public MigratableUtil()
               throws MigrationException
        Constructor.
        Throws:
        MigrationException - if the utility class fails to initialize

    • Method Detail

      • copyFile

        public void copyFile(@NotNull
                     Path sourceFile,
                     @NotNull
                     Path exportDirectory,
                     @NotNull
                     Collection<MigrationWarning> warnings)
              throws MigrationException
        Copies a file to a destination directory. The file to copy must be a relative path under ddf.home, and its path must not contain any symbolic link, otherwise the file will not be copied and a MigrationWarning will be returned.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - relative path to the file to copy
        exportDirectory - root directory where the file will be copied. If the file' relative path included any directories, those will be re-created under this directory.
        warnings - any warnings generated during this operation (e.g., source file outside of ddf.home) will be added to this collection
        Throws:
        MigrationException - thrown if a file system error prevents the file to be copied

      • copyDirectory

        public void copyDirectory(@NotNull
                          Path source,
                          @NotNull
                          Path exportDirectory,
                          @NotNull
                          Collection<MigrationWarning> warnings)
                   throws MigrationException
        Recursively copies a directory to a destination directory. The directory to copy must be a relative path under ddf.home, and its path must not contain any symbolic link, otherwise the directory will not be copied and a MigrationWarning will be returned.
        Parameters:
        source - relative path to the directory to copy
        exportDirectory - root directory where the file will be copied. If the file' relative path included any directories, those will be re-created under this directory.
        warnings - any warnings generated during this operation (e.g., source file outside of ddf.home) will be added to this collection
        Throws:
        MigrationException - thrown if file system error prevents the directory to be copied

      • copyFileFromSystemPropertyValue

        public void copyFileFromSystemPropertyValue(@NotNull
                                            String systemProperty,
                                            @NotNull
                                            Path exportDirectory,
                                            @NotNull
                                            Collection<MigrationWarning> warnings)
                                     throws MigrationException
        Copies a file, whose path is taken from a System property value, to a destination directory. The file to copy must be a relative path under ddf.home, and its path must not contain any symbolic link, otherwise the file will not be copied and a MigrationWarning will be returned.
        Parameters:
        systemProperty - name of the System property that contains the path to the source file
        exportDirectory - root directory where the file will be copied. If the file' relative path included any directories, those will be re-created under this directory.
        warnings - any warnings generated during this operation (e.g., source file outside of ddf.home) will be added to this collection
        Throws:
        MigrationException

      • copyFileFromJavaPropertyValue

        public void copyFileFromJavaPropertyValue(@NotNull
                                          Path propertyFilePath,
                                          @NotNull
                                          String javaProperty,
                                          @NotNull
                                          Path exportDirectory,
                                          @NotNull
                                          Collection<MigrationWarning> warnings)
                                   throws MigrationException
        Copies a file, whose path is taken from the value a Java properties file, to a destination. directory. The file to copy must be a relative path under ddf.home, and its path must not contain any symbolic link, otherwise the file will not be copied and a MigrationWarning will be returned.
        Parameters:
        propertyFilePath - path to the Java properties file that contains the path to the source file to copy
        javaProperty - name of the property inside the Java properties file that contains the path to the source file
        exportDirectory - path to the destination
        warnings - any warnings generated during this operation (e.g., source file outside of ddf.home) will be added to this collection
        Throws:
        MigrationException

      • getJavaPropertyValue

        public String getJavaPropertyValue(@NotNull
                                   Path propertyFilePath,
                                   @NotNull
                                   String javaProperty)
                            throws MigrationException
        Reads a java properties file and returns the value of the specified property.
        Parameters:
        propertyFilePath - path to the Java properties file that contains the path to the source file to copy
        javaProperty - name of the property inside the Java properties file that contains the path to the source file
        Returns:
        the value of the property if found, null otherwise
        Throws:
        MigrationException - thrown when the supplied properties file cannot be read
